meanings.definition: A type of fencing made of twisted strands of wire with sharp points or barbs at regular intervals.
meanings.sent1: The farmer put up barbwires around the field to keep the animals out.
meanings.sent2: The barbwires around the prison were meant to prevent any escape attempts.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to climb the barbwires but quickly learned its lesson.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like barbwires, sharp and cutting through the silence.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the barbwires gleaming in the sunlight was both intimidating and fascinating.

meanings.definition: To enclose or protect with barbed wire.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers barbwires the perimeter to secure the camp.
meanings.sent2: The rancher barbwires the pasture to keep the cattle from wandering off.
meanings.sent3: He barbwires the garden to keep the pesky rabbits away from his vegetables.
meanings.sent4: She barbwires her heart, not letting anyone get too close.
meanings.sent5: The construction workers barbwires the construction site to prevent unauthorized access.
